title: Serif Font I.D.
content:
Does anybody have any idea what typeface this is?

[http://i8.photobucket.com/albums/a48/lunardisko/Picture3-1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208141107/http:/i8.photobucket.com/albums/a48/lunardisko/Picture3-1.png "http://i8.photobucket.com/albums/a48/lunardisko/Picture3-1.png")

 [‹ Tesco Entertainment font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208141107/http:/typophile.com/node/44026 "Go to previous forum topic") [What font is this PLEASE!! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208141107/http:/typophile.com/node/44238 "Go to next forum topic")
author: j. cullen

comments.content:
It looks like it maybe [Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208141107/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/didot/)

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here
It isn’t Didot, the serifs are bracketed.

It looks to me like HFJ’s Didot, 96pt Light Roman.

EDIT: Nope. I’m wrong.

Could it be Big Caslon?
